result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Otis Green

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Otis Green appeared by video.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Otis Green.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a motion hearing.  Defense filed a motion in case 21CF3214 and requests this case track along.  Court grants request and schedules a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-07-2022

Defendant Otis Green in court.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Otis Green.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference to track along with 21CF3214.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-22-2022
JusticePoint GPS Rejection Notice; Received and Filed.

Conditions to include:
- No firearms or weapons of any kind
- Justice Point at Level 5 supervision
- 24 hour curfew with the exception of work and appointments that are confirmed with Justice Point
- Court orders GPS monitoring; if an electronic monitoring device (GPS) is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, defendant to be released and placed on the electronic monitoring (GPS) waitlist.

Defendant Otis Green not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Otis Green.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is called to address errors made in CCAP entries. $10,000 cash bail amended down to $6,000 cash bail.

Conditions to include:
- No firearms or weapons of any kind
- Justice Point at Level 5 supervision
- 24 hour curfew with the exception of work and appointments that are confirmed with Justice Point
- Court orders GPS monitoring; if an electronic monitoring device (GPS) is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, defendant to be released and placed on the electronic monitoring (GPS) waitlist.

Case remains calendared as previously scheduled.

Defendant Otis Green in custody and appeared by video.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court.   Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Otis Green not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin for Daniel Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD.. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Otis Green in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Otis Green in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Otis Green not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court on defense bail motion. Arguments heard.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains calendared for Preliminary Hearing on 05-25-2022 at 8:30 am, Branch PE.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Otis Green in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Otis Green in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Otis Green appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense request to be heard on bail.  
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c5e6133e-7164-4e97-66e6-4c87ef70fbdb

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
